newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Daily Variety - April 11.

text.p: The following stories appeared in Friday's Daily Variety:

* Boston investment firm Bain Capital Partners is backing a three-way independent merger of Live Entertainment, Trimark Holdings and October Pictures, sources said, which could create a $200 million company.
* Sony Pictures Entertainment will shut its low-budget independent unit Triumph Pictures following the completion of its current slate of pictures, the studio said.

* Although films by several of the biggest international directors -- Oliver Stone, Ang Lee, Abbas Kiarostami, Zhang Yimou -- have yet to be screened, the line-up for the 50th Cannes Film Festival is taking shape.

* News Corp Chief Executive Rupert Murdoch used a Senate hearing to pitch his soon-to-be-launched American Sky Broadcasting DBS service as a powerful new competitor which would limit the cable industry's ability to raise subscriber fees.
* With record attendance, extra space, new exhibitors, and bigger stands, international TV trade shows Mip opens Friday with a clutch of initiatives aimed at boosting European TV production.

* Shirley MacLaine will make her feature film directorial debut with the romantic comedy-drama "Kingdom Come" for producers David Kirkpatrick and Bernie Williams, from a script by Christopher Lofton and MacLaine.
